alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:09PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Elbert and eastern Arapahoe Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 708 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Deer Trail to near Simla, or along a line extending from 40 miles south of Fort Morgan to 22 miles west of Limon. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Simla, Deer Trail and Agate. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
